result.execSummary:
The defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Frankie Valdez Ramirez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Frankie Valdez Ramirez was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 184 days in the House of Correction, with 184 days credit for time served, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Restitution set at $0.
-All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due by the end of supervision in case 16CF1111.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case calendared for jury trial. The parties have reached an agreement. Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: 
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Case proceeded to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Charge amended to Receiving Stolen Property, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.34(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR JOINDER, FILED

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case joined with 16CF1111. Case in court for final pre-trial. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 37 on April 5, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez not in court, in custody and not produced.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests speedy trial demand.  Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on January 10, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. -Per Jan at public defender's office will appoint counsel. Defendant has pending preliminary hearing for caes #16CF1111 on January 10, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. in PE. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez not in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. A. Bowe not present in court, but Asst. District Atty. I. Parthum has had contact with her on today's date.
Asst. District Atty. I. Parthum informed Court that Atty. Bowe has been unable to contact the defendant.

Court instructs the State to rescind the subpoenaes for witnesses, orders jury trial vacated.

Warrant issued on March 10, 2016 remains in effect with remand to the Court.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting adjournment of today's scheduled trial - officers who were subpoenaed are not available.
Court notes that a speedy trial demand had been entered as to this case and if trial is adjourned, it will not be held within the speedy trial demand time limits.  Therefore, Court will modify bail.
Court grants adjournment of the trial; any motion to join will be heard on the next court date.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and GRANTED.  Court MODIFIED bail to $5,000.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) No contact with the victims.

**Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Jeffrey Conen, Branch 30.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to Judge William Brash, Branch 21.

Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Frankie Valdez Ramirez in custody.  Ronald Dague for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF6084 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Marco Lopez-MPD Officer.     State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
